title: Banaras Hindu University

article.question: Why is BHU famous?
paragraph: Banaras Hindu University (BHU) is a famous university located in Varanasi, India. It was established in 1916 by Pandit Madan Mohan Malaviya, who was a well-known leader and educationist in India. He worked with Annie Besant, another famous leader, to create this university.

The idea behind BHU was to provide high-quality education in India so that Indian students wouldn't have to go abroad for their studies. Malaviya believed that it was important for Indian students to understand and appreciate their own culture and traditions while also learning about modern science and arts. He wanted the university to combine modern and traditional education.

BHU was different from other universities of its time because it was a residential university. This means that students would live on the campus while studying. Most other universities in India at that time only conducted exams and awarded degrees, but didn’t have a campus where students lived and attended classes.

The university's main campus is located near the Ganges river and covers over 1,300 acres. It has a lot of buildings that are designed in a beautiful Indo-Gothic style. The campus has more than 65 hostels where over 12,000 students can live.

article.question: What courses BHU offers?
paragraph: BHU offers many different courses and has colleges for various subjects like Sanskrit, Science and Technology, Agriculture, Medicine, Commerce, Music and Fine Arts, and even a flying club for basic pilot training!

article.question: Who are famous people from BHU?
paragraph: Some famous people who studied at BHU include the musician Bhupen Hazarika, poet Harivanshrai Bachchan, and scientist CNR Rao. Pandit Madan Mohan Malaviya, who founded the university, also served as its Vice-Chancellor​​​​.

article.title: Places to visit in BHU
article.question: What are timings of BHU vishwanath temple?
paragraph: New Vishwanath Temple: Located in the heart of BHU, this temple dedicated to Lord Shiva is a must-visit for its spiritual significance and architectural beauty. Visiting Hours: Typically, temples in Varanasi open early in the morning around 4:00 AM and close late in the evening, around 10:00 PM. However, these timings can vary, so it's best to check locally for the exact timings during your visit.

Bharat Kala Bhavan Museum: This museum on the BHU campus is home to an extensive collection of Indian art and artifacts, perfect for those interested in the cultural history of India​​. Visiting Hours: The museum is open from 10:30 AM to 4:30 PM, Monday to Saturday. It's closed on Sundays and university holidays.
